result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas F Paterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation concurrent with Marathon County 14CM53.  Probation to be transferred to Monroe County.
Concurrent with: 2014CM53
on any vehicles T&R in defendant's name and on defendant himself; IID to be installed within 14 days; half-priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies

miscConds.notes:
Corrected; charge should be OWI 4th

Defendant to participate in and be in compliance with LaCrosse Area Veterans Court.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Jail concurrent to 14CM53, with huber for work/treatment, if defendant eligible under jail classification system; no objection to EM in LaCrosse County through the Justice Sanctions Services program, while living in Monroe County if eligible/available; to commence within 45 days at discretion of PO; defendant to be in full compliance with drivers safety program and IID orders to be eligible for huber
Concurrent with: 14CM53

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Order and Veteran Participant Agreement to be Bound by La Crosse Area Veterans Court Rules, Policies and Procedures (orig. filed in 14CM53)

Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CM53, 14CM194 (now 14CF832), 14TR265 called: 10:38am
State appears by ADA Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty Austin Mort.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  Waiver of Prelim. filed in 14CM194 (nka 14CF832)
 
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  COURT NOW converts case to 14CF832 as count is felony.


State moves to:
14CM53 - Ct. 2 (PAC 3rd)>>DISMISS
14TR265>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA: 
14CM53 - Ct. 1 (OWI 3rd)>>NO CONTEST
14CF832 - Ct. 1 (OWI 4th)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
14CM53>>Sentence W/held; 18 months Probation
CONDITIONS: $2450 inclusive; 160 days MCJ, to commence w/in 45 days at discretion of PO, w/huber for work/treatment, if defendant eligible under jail classification system, no objection to EM in LaCrosse County through the Justice Sanctions Service program, while living in Monroe County, if eligible/available; Defendant to be in full compliance with drivers safety program and IID orders to be eligible for huber;  28 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 28 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; Defendant to participate in and be in compliance w/LaCrosse area Veterans Court.

14CF832>>Sentence W/held; 3 years Probation, concurrent with 14CM53
CONDITIONS: $600+ CC; 6 months MCJ, concurrent to 14CM53, w/huber for work/treatment, if defendant eligible under jail classification system, no objection to EM in LaCrosse County throught the Justice Sanctions Services program, while living in Monroe County if eligible/available, to commence w/in 45 days at discretion of PO; Defendant to be in full compliance with drivers safety program and IID orders to be eligible for huber; 30 month DL Rev w/credit; AODA (only one necessary);   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 30 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifies; Defendant to participate in and be in compliance w/LaCrosse area Veterans Court.

>>Probation to be transferred to MONROE County
>>Jail time to be transferred to LACROSSE County
